verses.verse: Let a man <S%G444><s%> regard <S%G3049><s%> us in this <S%G3779><s%> manner, <S%G3779><s%> as servants <S%G5257><s%> of Christ, <S%G5547><s%> and stewards <S%G3623><s%> of the mysteries <S%G3466><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>
In this <S%G5602><s%> case, <S%G5602><s%> moreover, <S%G3062><s%> it is required <S%G523><s%> of stewards <S%G3623><s%> that one <S%G5100><s%> be found <S%G2147><s%> trustworthy. <S%G4103><s%>

But to me it is a very <S%G1646><s%> small <S%G1646><s%> thing <S%G1646><s%> that I should be examined <S%G350><s%> by you, or <S%G2228><s%> by [any] human <S%G442><s%> court; <S%G2250><s%> in fact, <S%G235><s%> I do not even <S%G3761><s%> examine <S%G350><s%> myself. <S%G1683><s%>

For I am <S%G4924><s%> conscious <S%G4924><s%> of nothing <S%G3762><s%> against myself, <S%G1683><s%> yet <S%G235><s%> I am not by this <S%G3778><s%> acquitted; <S%G1344><s%> but the one who examines <S%G350><s%> me is the Lord. <S%G2962><s%>

Therefore <S%G5620><s%> do not go on passing <S%G2919><s%> judgment <S%G2919><s%> before <S%G4253><s%> the time, <S%G2540><s%> [but wait] until <S%G2193><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> comes <S%G2064><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> will both <S%G2532><s%> bring <S%G5461><s%> to light <S%G5461><s%> the things <S%G2927><s%> hidden <S%G2927><s%> in the darkness <S%G4655><s%> and disclose <S%G5319><s%> the motives <S%G1012><s%> of [men's] hearts; <S%G2588><s%> and then <S%G5119><s%> each <S%G1538><s%> man's praise <S%G1868><s%> will come <S%G1096><s%> to him from God. <S%G2316><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things, <S%G3778><s%> brethren, <S%G80><s%> I have figuratively <S%G3345><s%> applied <S%G3345><s%> to myself <S%G1683><s%> and Apollos <S%G625><s%> for your sakes, <S%G1223><s%> that in us you might learn <S%G3129><s%> not to exceed <S%G5228><s%> what <S%G3739><s%> is written, <S%G1125><s%> in order <S%G2443><s%> that no <S%G3361><s%> one <S%G1520><s%> of you might become arrogant <S%G5448><s%> in behalf <S%G5228><s%> of one <S%G1520><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> the other. <S%G2087><s%>

For who <S%G5101><s%> regards <S%G1252><s%> you as superior <S%G1252><s%>? And what <S%G5101><s%> do you have <S%G2192><s%> that you did not receive <S%G2983><s%>? But if <S%G1487><s%> you did receive <S%G2983><s%> it, why <S%G5101><s%> do you boast <S%G2744><s%> as if <S%G5613><s%> you had not received <S%G2983><s%> it?

You are already <S%G2235><s%> filled, <S%G2880><s%> you have already <S%G2235><s%> become <S%G4147><s%> rich, <S%G4147><s%> you have become <S%G936><s%> kings <S%G936><s%> without <S%G5565><s%> us; and [I] would <S%G3785><s%> indeed <S%G1065><s%> that you had become <S%G936><s%> kings <S%G936><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that we also <S%G2532><s%> might reign <S%G4821><s%> with you.

For, I think, <S%G1380><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> has exhibited <S%G584><s%> us apostles <S%G652><s%> last <S%G2078><s%> of all, <S%G2078><s%> as men <S%G1935><s%> condemned <S%G1935><s%> to death; <S%G1935><s%> because <S%G3754><s%> we have become <S%G1096><s%> a spectacle <S%G2302><s%> to the world, <S%G2889><s%> both <S%G2532><s%> to angels <S%G32><s%> and to men. <S%G444><s%>

We are fools <S%G3474><s%> for Christ <S%G5547><s%>'s sake, <S%G1223><s%> but you are prudent <S%G5429><s%> in Christ; we are weak, <S%G772><s%> but you are strong; <S%G2478><s%> you are distinguished, <S%G1741><s%> but we are without <S%G820><s%> honor. <S%G820><s%>

To this <S%G3588><s%> present <S%G737><s%> hour <S%G5610><s%> we are both <S%G2532><s%> hungry <S%G3983><s%> and thirsty, <S%G1372><s%> and are poorly <S%G1130><s%> clothed, <S%G1130><s%> and are roughly <S%G2852><s%> treated, <S%G2852><s%> and are homeless; <S%G790><s%>

and we toil, <S%G2872><s%> working <S%G2038><s%> with our own <S%G2398><s%> hands; <S%G5495><s%> when we are reviled, <S%G3058><s%> we bless; <S%G2127><s%> when we are persecuted, <S%G1377><s%> we endure; <S%G430><s%>

when we are slandered, <S%G7049><s%> we try to conciliate; <S%G3870><s%> we have become <S%G1096><s%> as the scum <S%G4027><s%> of the world, <S%G2889><s%> the dregs <S%G4067><s%> of all <S%G3956><s%> things, <S%G3956><s%> [even] until <S%G2193><s%> now. <S%G737><s%>
I do not write <S%G1125><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things <S%G3778><s%> to shame <S%G1788><s%> you, but to admonish <S%G3560><s%> you as my beloved <S%G27><s%> children. <S%G5043><s%>

For if <S%G1437><s%> you were to have <S%G2192><s%> countless <S%G3463><s%> tutors <S%G3807><s%> in Christ, <S%G5547><s%> yet <S%G235><s%> [you would] not [have] many <S%G4183><s%> fathers; <S%G3962><s%> for in Christ <S%G5547><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> I became <S%G1080><s%> your father <S%G1080><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> the gospel. <S%G2098><s%>
I exhort <S%G3870><s%> you therefore, <S%G3767><s%> be imitators <S%G3402><s%> of me.

For this <S%G3778><s%> reason <S%G1223><s%> I have sent <S%G3992><s%> to you Timothy, <S%G5095><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> is my beloved <S%G27><s%> and faithful <S%G4103><s%> child <S%G5043><s%> in the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> and he will remind <S%G363><s%> you of my ways <S%G3598><s%> which are in Christ, <S%G5547><s%> just <S%G2531><s%> as I teach <S%G1321><s%> everywhere <S%G3837><s%> in every <S%G3956><s%> church. <S%G1577><s%>
Now <S%G1161><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> have become arrogant, <S%G5448><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> I were not coming <S%G2064><s%> to you.

But I will come <S%G2064><s%> to you soon, <S%G5030><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> wills, <S%G2309><s%> and I shall find <S%G1097><s%> out, not the words <S%G3056><s%> of those <S%G3588><s%> who are arrogant, <S%G5448><s%> but their power. <S%G1411><s%>
For the kingdom <S%G932><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> does not consist in words, <S%G3056><s%> but in power. <S%G1411><s%>

What <S%G5101><s%> do you desire <S%G2309><s%>? Shall I come <S%G2064><s%> to you with a rod <S%G4464><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> with love <S%G26><s%> and a spirit <S%G4151><s%> of gentleness <S%G4240><s%>?
